channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Mini cabs blocking junction, 21st November
item.description:
Mini cabs and other cars blocking junction, parked on double yellow lines, through day. Dangerous for other drivers, pedestrians and cycles. Contravenes Highway Code. Streets and parking in area inadequately supervised.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Banyard Road, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road requires full resurfacing, 21st November
item.description:
The road on Rectory Road between the war memorial roundabout and Blakeney Road requires resurfacing. Not potholes filled in individually but a full resurface. The road is noisy and full of holes and imperfections making it dangerous for drivers with potential to ruin tyres. It is also incredibly noisy for residents listening to car and lorries clatter past. Damage is also being done to properties due to the vibrations which we will seek compensation from the council for if resurfacing doesn't take place. Beckenham Hill Road was recently resurfaced and the sound and vibration difference is huge. Residents on Rectory Road deserve the same.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 83, Rectory Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
